result.execSummary:
The defendant Cortez L Wallace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: With any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cortez L Wallace

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges by August 14, 2015, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered all non-mandatory costs waived due to defendant's financial instability.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Cortez L Wallace in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Cortez L Wallace in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

On motion of the State, Court ordered Penalty Enhancer stricken (dismissed). 

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Cortez L Wallace not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cortez L Wallace in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Cortez L Wallace in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
